cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and summarization. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of seq2seq learning, which is a popular technique in the field of NLP. 

The paper also involves the use of copy mechanisms, which are commonly used in abstractive summarization. This suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper involves the use of experimental results to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach, which suggests that it could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
